ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: NIPA,The National Institute of Performing Arts was registered as a Trust, in February, 1989 at Ahmedabad and NIPA was registered as a Society, in February 1999 at New Delhi. Meanwhile, it has continued to promote various facets of amateur theatrical activities in the country and abroad. It has organized 15 International Festival so far. The NIPA has been active in the field of Performing Arts since 1985. Among its early activities was holding of the National Theater Workshop, in March, 1985 at Kalol in Gujarat. It was at this workshop that NIPA was formally inaugurated. In the same year, NIPA sought membership of International Amateur Theater Association (AITA / IATA), and obtained the same in early 1987. By extending their affiliation NIPA is promoting, as its associate member, to 26 State Theater organizations.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Partnering Hope Into Action Foundation is a charity working to tackle poverty across India. We were established in 2005 as a Public Trust. Our team, partners and networks have roots and knowledge in sustainable development work in India stretching back more than fifty years. Phia is taking forward the work of its co-collaborators who had successfully bid for a grant from the UKaid DFID and implemented one of Indias largest civil society program from 2009-2016, which was called the Poorest Areas Civil Society (PACS) programme. PACS worked in 7 of Indias poorest States to help socially excluded communities to claim their rights and entitlements more effectively. In total, PACS worked with 225 Civil Society Organisation (CSO) partners, covering 90 districts, 517 blocks, 22,404 villages and 23,206 Community Based Organisations (CBOs) to reach 9.6 million people.

ngoList.title: PARTNERS FOR LAW IN DEVELOPMENT
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: PLD is a legal resource group committed to the realization of social justice and equality for all women. We believe that the attainment of womens equality is integral to the pursuit of social justice; and rights are necessary means by which discrimination and marginalisation be challenged, and equality facilitated. As a legal resource group, law is a primary site of engagement for us. We believe that the pursuit of human rights and social transformation through the law are possible only when combined with mobilisation, rights education and empowerment carried out in collaboration with other social justice actors. Our work methods therefore involve partnerships and collaborations at the community, state, national and regional levels, combining diverse strengths to monitor, create knowledge and advocate for the realisation of social justice and womens equality. Additionally, partnerships are also an effective means by which we develop capacities, leadership and a community of practice in the womens rights sector.

ngoList.title: Parvatiya Kala Kendra
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Parvatiya Kala Kendra was created with a view to promotefolk forms of Uttarakhand comprising the central Himalayan regions of kumaon and Garhwal that is folk forms associated with the rituals ceremonies dances and songs legends ballads tales as also the traditional Ramlila.The programmes of the Kendra sbecame popular that not only voluntary institutions in Indian Cities invited the Kendra to present these programmes but also ICCR sent the Kendra team to Tunisia Algeria Egypt Syria and Jordan in Nineteen Eighty Four and to North Korea China and Thailand in Nineteen Eighty Eight. the names of the major plays are Rajula Malushahi Rasik Ramol Ajua Bafaul Ramlila Goriya InderSabha Meghdoot Amir Khusrao.The Kendra has created shows based on Indian freedom struggle and charts newer concepts to tap the Himalayan culture by working on future themes

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Developed as a Regional Youth Support Centre in eastern part of India. Worked in partnership with dist. admin. and govt. edu. Institutions. Contributed to various processes consultations such as National Youth Policy Odisha State Youth Policy MDGs Saksham Prog. National Volunteering prog. Designed innovative experiential learning journeys for young people. Created knowledge products such as lifeskills curriculum in Odia Peer Education Model and launched a course on Youth Facilitation.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Juba Sathi Programme is an intervention (partnership with District Administration) to build leadership of youth and community members to access their entitlements and developmental benefits in Sambalpur, Odisha.

The aim of the Pathmakers programme is to develop leadership among youth for positive social change through volunteerism.Kasturiis a project to create safe and empowering spaces for young people; build capacity of youth to aware on gender, and sexual and reproductive health and associated rights (SRHR issues) Youth Development and Livelihood Intervention focuses on integrating youth development perspective in livelihood/similar issues among organisation.
